description.narrative: The proposed investment to Bajaj Finance Limited. (BFL or the Company) consists of an up to US$150 million senior loan for up to 5 years from IFC to support BFL expand its lending to Micro, Small and Medium enterprises (MSMEs) and women-owned MSMEs, who play an important role within the economy and contribute towards job creation in India (the Project). BFL through their own balance sheet will direct 3X of the IFCs loan towards the MSMEs segment thus enabling a combined MSME funding of US$600 million.

Improved access to finance for MSMEs including women owned MSMEs: The MSME sector is extremely critical for the development of the country as it accounts for over 30% of the GDP and provides employment to more than 110mn people. Further, the MSME segment, which has been facing growth and funding challenges even before COVID-19, has experienced further constraints since the pandemic, owing to significant risk-aversion amongst lenders. The proposed investment would increase availability of financing to this underserved MSME segments, including women-owned MSMEs which are even more constraint for funding compared to the overall MSME segment.
